info.title: Azure Red Hat OpenShift Hosted Control Planes Service

get.description: List the operations for the provider

ApiProfile.description: Information about the API of a cluster.

url.description: URL endpoint for the API server

visibility.description: should the API server be accessible from the internet

Azure.ResourceManager.ResourceProvisioni.description: The provisioning state of a resource type.

ConsoleProfile.description: Configuration of the cluster web console

url.description: The cluster web console URL endpoint

DnsProfile.description: DNS contains the DNS settings of the cluster

baseDomain.description: BaseDomain is the base DNS domain of the cluster.

baseDomainPrefix.description:
BaseDomainPrefix is the unique name of the cluster representing the OpenShift's cluster name.
BaseDomainPrefix is the name that will appear in the cluster's DNS, provisioned cloud providers resources

Effect.description: The taint effect the same as in K8s

HcpOpenShiftClusterNodePoolPatch.description: The template for adding optional properties.

properties.description: Represents the patchable node pool properties

HcpOpenShiftClusterNodePoolResource.description: Concrete tracked resource types can be created by aliasing this type using a specific property type.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

identity.description: The managed service identities assigned to this resource.

value.description: The HcpOpenShiftClusterNodePoolResource items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

HcpOpenShiftClusterPatch.description: The template for adding optional properties.

provisioningState.description: The status of the last operation.
The status of the last operation.

version.description: Version of the control plane components

console.description: Shows the cluster web console information

api.description: Shows the cluster API server profile

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

identity.description: The managed service identities assigned to this resource.

value.description: The HcpOpenShiftClusterResource items on this page

HcpOpenShiftVersionResource.description: HcpOpenShiftVersions represents a location based available HCP cluster versions

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

value.description: The HcpOpenShiftVersionResource items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

HcpOpenShiftVersionsProperties.description: HcpOpenShiftVersionsProperties is the installable cluster version

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the resource.

ManagedServiceIdentityUpdate.description: The template for adding optional properties.

type.description: The type of managed identity assigned to this resource.

userAssignedIdentities.description: The identities assigned to this resource by the user.

networkType.description: The main controller responsible for rendering the core networking components

values.name: OVNKubernetes
values.description: THE OVN network plugin for the OpenShift cluster

podCidr.description:
The CIDR of the pod IP addresses
example: 10.128.0.0/14

serviceCidr.description:
The CIDR block for assigned service IPs,
example: 172.30.0.0/16

machineCidr.description:
from which to assign machine IP addresses,
example: 10.0.0.0/16

hostPrefix.description: Network host prefix which is defaulted to 23 if not specified.

NetworkSecurityGroupResourceId.description: A type definition that refers the id to an Azure Resource Manager resource.

min.description: The minimum number of nodes in the node pool

max.description: The maximum number of nodes in the node pool

NodePoolPatchProperties.description: Represents the patchable node pool properties

replicas.description: The number of worker nodes, it cannot be used together with autoscaling

autoScaling.description: Representation of a autoscaling in a node pool.

labels.description:
K8s labels to propagate to the NodePool Nodes
The good example of the label is `node-role.kubernetes.io/master: ""`

subnetId.description: The resourceId for the subnet used by the workers

vmSize.description:
The VM size according to the documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/sizes

diskSizeGiB.description: The OS disk size in GiB

diskStorageAccountType.description:
The type of the disk storage account
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/disks-types

availabilityZone.description:
The availability zone for the node pool.
Please read the documentation to see which regions support availability zones
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/availability-zones/az-overview

encryptionAtHost.description: Whether the worker machines should be encrypted at host

diskEncryptionSetId.description:
Disk Encryption Set ID that will be used for encryption the Nodes disks
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/disk-encryption-overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/disk-encryption

replicas.description: The number of worker nodes, it cannot be used together with autoscaling

autoScaling.description: Representation of a autoscaling in a node pool.

labels.description:
K8s labels to propagate to the NodePool Nodes
The good example of the label is `node-role.kubernetes.io/master: ""`

OperatorsAuthenticationProfile.description: The configuration that the operators of the cluster have to authenticate to Azure.

userAssignedIdentities.description:
Represents the information related to Azure User-Assigned managed identities needed
to perform Operators authentication based on Azure User-Assigned Managed Identities

managedResourceGroup.description: Resource group to put cluster resources

subnetId.description: ResourceId for the subnet used by the control plane

networkSecurityGroupId.description: ResourceId for the network security group attached to the cluster subnet

operatorsAuthentication.description: The configuration that the operators of the cluster have to authenticate to Azure

issuerUrl.description:
URL for the OIDC provider to be used for authentication
to authenticate against user Azure cloud account

values.name: Accepted
values.description: Non-terminal state indicating the resource has been accepted

values.name: Deleting
values.description: Non-terminal state indicating the resource is deleting

values.name: Provisioning
values.description: Non-terminal state indicating the resource is provisioning

values.name: Updating
values.description: Non-terminal state indicating the resource is updating

SubnetResourceId.description: A type definition that refers the id to an Azure Resource Manager resource.

Taint.description: Taint is controlling the node taint and its effects

key.description:
The key of the taint
The good example of the taint key is `node-role.kubernetes.io/master`

value.description:
The value of the taint
The good example of the taint value is `NoSchedule`

effect.description:
The effect of the taint
The good example of the taint effect is `NoSchedule`

UserAssignedIdentitiesProfile.description:
Represents the information related to Azure User-Assigned managed identities needed
to perform Operators authentication based on Azure User-Assigned Managed Identities

controlPlaneOperators.description:
The set of Azure User-Assigned Managed Identities leveraged for the Control Plane
operators of the cluster. The set of required managed identities is dependent on the
Cluster's OpenShift version.

dataPlaneOperators.description:
The set of Azure User-Assigned Managed Identities leveraged for the Data Plane
operators of the cluster. The set of required managed identities is dependent on the
Cluster's OpenShift version.

serviceManagedIdentity.description:
Represents the information associated to an Azure User-Assigned Managed Identity whose
purpose is to perform service level actions.

UserAssignedIdentityResourceId.description: A type definition that refers the id to an Azure Resource Manager resource.

id.description: ID is the unique identifier of the version.

channelGroup.description: ChannelGroup is the name of the set to which this version belongs. Each version belongs to only a single set.

availableUpgrades.description: AvailableUpgrades is a list of version names the current version can be upgraded to.

Visibility.description: The visibility of the API server

values.name: public
values.description: The API server is visible from the internet.

values.name: private
values.description: The API server is not visible from the internet.

taintKey.description:
taintKey is the k8s valid key of the taint type on the nodepool nodes
The good example of the taint key is `node-role.kubernetes.io/master`

taintValue.description:
taintValue is the k8s valid value of the taint type on the nodepool nodes
The good example of the taint value is `NoSchedule`
